decks.notes: The deck revolves around Svyelun of Sea and Sky as the Commander, focusing on a heavy control strategy to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a plethora of counterspells like Force of Will and Mana Leak, along with bounce spells like Cyclonic Rift and Boomerang, the deck aims to keep the opponent off balance and prevent them from executing their strategy. The inclusion of creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Murktide Regent provides a win condition while the rest of the deck focuses on controlling the board and hand. The mana base is optimized for a smooth curve and consistency in casting spells.

This deck revolves around using various spells and abilities to quickly and efficiently combo off using Old Stickfingers. The deck contains a variety of ramp, removal, and tutor spells to ensure that you can assemble your combo pieces quickly. By utilizing reanimation spells such as Animate Dead and Reanimate, along with powerful spells like Yawgmoth's Will and Dark Ritual, you can generate a lot of mana and cast a huge Tendrils of Agony to finish off your opponent in one explosive turn. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect your combo and ensure that your opponent can't stop you before it's too late.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain control over the game through a variety of counterspells and removal spells. The Commander, Errant and Giada, provide additional support for this control strategy. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells like Counterspell, Force of Will, and Mana Leak, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Swift Reconfiguration. Additionally, the deck includes creatures that can disrupt the opponent's strategy and provide additional utility, such as Brazen Borrower and Vendilion Clique. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures, this deck aims to prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively.

This deck focuses on utilizing Lazav, Wearer of Faces as the commander to control the game through a combination of disruption, removal, and reanimation spells. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Counterspell, while also removing threats with Fatal Push, Toxic Deluge, and Bone Shards. By quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Buried Alive and Animate Dead, Lazav can take advantage of powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Phage the Untouchable. The deck also includes a strong mana base to support its control elements, allowing it to consistently cast its spells and outvalue the opponent over time.

This deck focuses on ramping up quickly with cards like Burgeoning, Exploration, and Azusa, Lost but Seeking, allowing the player to get ahead on mana and deploy threats faster than their opponent. The deck aims to control the game with cards like All Is Dust, Oblivion Stone, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, while also generating value with cards like Ramunap Excavator and Life from the Loam. The deck has strong synergies with land-based cards like Titania, Protector of Argoth, Dark Depths, and Thespian's Stage, allowing for powerful combos and threats. Overall, the deck seeks to outpace and outvalue the opponent, using its land-centric strategy to control the game and secure victory.

The deck focuses on a wide variety of aggressive creatures and removal spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of powerful red and white removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Swords to Plowshares, and Terminate allows for efficient removal of threats on the board. Cards like Goblin Guide, Seasoned Pyromancer, and Jirina, Dauntless General provide a strong aggressive presence on the battlefield. The deck also includes powerful utility creatures like Mother of Runes and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of strong creatures, removal spells, and utility creatures, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain control of the battlefield throughout the game.

The deck revolves around a control strategy using a wide variety of spells to disrupt the opponent's plan and control the pace of the game. With cards like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Spell Pierce, the deck aims to counter or remove key threats played by the opponent. Additionally, the deck includes powerful reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to bring back powerful creatures like Griselbrand or Iona, Shield of Emeria. The deck utilizes a mix of graveyard recursion, card draw, and creature removal to outvalue the opponent and secure the win through either overwhelming board presence or disrupting the opponent's game plan.
